```{js, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
function filter_default() {
    document.getElementById("GENDER").getElementsByClassName("selectized") 
[0].selectize.setValue("both", false);
 }
$(document).ready(filter_default);
```

```{r, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
library(flexdashboard)
library(WDI)
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(crosstalk)
library(ggthemes)
library(DT)
library(scales)
library(manipulateWidget); 

library(reactable)
library(lubridate)
library(hrbrthemes)
library(htmltools)
library(sparkline)
library(dplyr)

myfont="Times New Roman"
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)


centralities<-read.table("centralities.csv",header=TRUE,sep=";",quote="\r",dec = ".")
sharedCentrality<-SharedData$new(centralities)

p_degree<-ggplot(sharedCentrality, aes(x=YEAR-1999, y=score_mean, group=MOBILITY, color=MOBILITY)) + 
  geom_line(size=0.7) +
  geom_point(shape=21, size=0.1, fill="red") +
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=score_mean -score_se , ymax=score_mean+score_se ), width=0.5,colour="red",
                position=position_dodge(0.01), alpha=0.7)+
  labs( x="Career age", y = "score")+
  theme_classic()+ 
  theme(legend.title=element_blank(),legend.text=element_text(family=myfont,size="16",face="bold"),legend.position="top",axis.text  =  element_text( family=myfont,size=12),axis.title  =  element_text( family=myfont,size=20,face = "bold"))+
  scale_color_manual(values=c('#0000FF','#808080'))+
  facet_wrap( ~ score, ncol=2, scales = "free")+ labs(color = "")

gg_degree<-ggplotly(p_degree)



bscols(widths = c(2,2,12,12),
       div(style = css(width="2%", height="2px", background_color="gray")),
       list(
         filter_select(id = "GENDER", label = "Gender",
                       sharedData = sharedCentrality, group = ~ GENDER,multiple=FALSE,allLevels = FALSE)
       ),div(style = css(width="100%", height="2px", background_color="gray")),
       gg_degree)
  
  





```

This figure compares four centrality measures of mobile and non-mobile researchers in collaboration networks during their career development. Number of observations are 18,734 and 29,122 for mobile and non-mobile researchers, resp. Red error bars show standard errors. Career age has a range of 1 to 16 years (year of first publication and 15 years after that). Using the filter, results of a specific gender can be displayed.
